hackathon-description-text: BrickHack: RIT's premiere collegiate hackathon. February 11th ignites a weekend devoted to 400 designers and coders sinking 24 hours into building and creating. Mentors and industry representatives will also join the fray to lend expertise, and share wisdom. Expect food, swag, and timeless brick-laden memories.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: FOSS Researcher and Community Liaison - RIT
Open Source Community Manager at Hillary for America
Friendly technologist & leader who loves programming

hackathon-eligibility: You must be a registered participant of BrickHack in order to qualify. You must also be over the age of 18 and a current student or be within one year of your graduation date if you have already graduated.
hackathon-requirements:
At least on person from your team must be at the judging fair in order for your submission to be considered.
Judging will happen in person on Sunday Feb. 12, 2017.
hackathon-rules:
1) All hacks must be started AFTER hacking begins.
2) Any software or hardware from a third party MUST also be publicly available to use by anybody else.
3) Do NOT steal anyone else's source code.
4) Judges make the final decision on any winner of a prize.
5) Have fun, learn something, and make something awesome!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 Amazon Gift Card for the team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Real Time Network Communication - Datto

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: To qualify for the Best Use of Microsoft Technology prize, hackers need to incorporate at least one of the following products/services into their project:
Apple Watch for each member of the team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Watson IoT platform on Bluemix - IBM

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: UPS backpacks with bluetooth speakers, shirts, water bottles and other assorted UPS swag.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most creative use of the UPS APIs

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use the SparkPost API to send an email or receive an email and perform an action via inbound domains and relay webhooks.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Build Something Awesome using the SparkPost API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of our ideation theme.

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 Lomb Memorial Dr, Rochester, NY 14623, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: All decisions made by judges are final.

hackathon-location-address: 1 Lomb Memorial Dr, Rochester, NY 14623, USA
